reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe idea is nice and the underwater bowling alley looks good. Unfortunately there isn't a lot more than that. There is one unfinished baseball area that looks very poor and that's all. The price is way too high for the content even for an early access game. I like the idea and I hope it will become a good game at some point in the future.
voteText: 35 of 38 people (92%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Until Updates are made this game in it's current state should be free or much cheaper ($0.99 at most).  The bowling game is not even similar to a real bowling experience as you bowl 3 rounds with 3 balls and no score is kept.  Just abysmal.

The baseball game is very inaccurate and for some reason they give you a bat in both hands rather than designating one.  Furthermore, actually attempting to make contact with the ball is a far greater challenge than attempting to find a positive in the only other experience available at such time with this game; the lackluster and worthless bowling experience.

Just stay away from purchase as this is not even a complete demo at this point.  I wish there were some way to get a refund for such a steep price for a nearly worthless expenditure of your time and money.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nReally don't know how this could have been priced so high. Feels like a quite unfinished demo. Bats (2?) dont work for the baseball game (?) well and bowling only sorta works. Twenty dollars?

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I think this has potential, I wouldn't buy in unless you're interested in actively helping shape the game or until the game has some notion of progression (score tracking, leaderboards, difficulty settings, challenges etc) but this could be the Wii sports of the vive and that's pretty exciting.
